page.title: 04Colvend: Ecology
page.content: There is no industry and little building in this area so people are anxious to preserve wild life. Rough Island,in the estuary of the River Urr is a bird reserve owned by the National Trust.It is about 1km. long by 0.5km wide and at its highest point is about 30m.above sea level. People are not allowed to go on the island in May or June when the birds are nesting. Oyster-catchers,seagulls, terns and plovers nest on the island. An oyster-catcher's egg is greyish with black spots. They look like the pebbles on the beach so you must be careful not to stand on them. When it was low-tide we walked across the mud from Rockcliffe and climbed to the cairn. If you do not carry up a stone for the cairn,you might have bad luck!
